bibl.title: Letter from George A. Jones to the Gibson Bros., April 26, 1901

div1.p: The Surgeon General accepts the estimate the Gibson Bros. will charge for publishing 300 copies of the phamphlet, “The Etiology of Yellow Fever.”

div1.head: Letter from George A. Jones to the Gibson Bros., April 26, 1901
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject:
71980
M
1901
In reply refer to No.
DEPARTMENT.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Sternberg
Washington, April 26, 1901.
CARDED.
Messrs Gibson Bros.,
1238 Penna. Ave.,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:-
div1.p:
I am instructed by the Surgeon General to inform you that your
estimate for three hundred (300) copies of the pamphlet “The
Etiology of Yellow Fever” including the cost of reproducing the
six (6) diagrams for $456.00, has been accepted and to request that
the work be done and the pamphlets furnished at the earliest date
practicable.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, G.A. Jones Chief Clerk.
